      • xyToLatLng

        public static LatLng xyToLatLng(int x,
                int y,
                int zoom,
                double leftEdge,
                double topEdge)
        Converts (x, y) pixel co-ordinates to a Google Maps LatLng object. By default the map is assumed to be at the top left corner of the world map.
        Parameters:
        x - The x co-ordinates of the pixel to convert to longitude
        y - The y co-ordinates of the pixel to convert to latitude
        zoom - The maximum zoom level for the pixel map being used. This can be calculated by passing the map's total width and height in pixels into the Utils.getMaxZoom() function.
        leftEdge - The degrees that the map's left edge starts from
        topEdge - The degrees that the map's top edge starts from
        Returns:
        A Google Map LatLng object.

      • filterAndSortLocations

        public static java.util.ArrayList<MappedInNode> filterAndSortLocations(java.util.ArrayList<MappedInLocation> locations,
                                                       MappedInMap currentMap)
        Group the nodes by map id before sending them to be shown. Also filters nodes for unique locations so they don't repeat on the same map!
        Parameters:
        locations -
        currentMap -
        Returns:
        An array of filtered nodes corresponding to their parent locations.

        Parameters:
        color - The colour value to modify the alpha channel of
        factor - The amount by which to increase or decrease the alpha value by. Has to be between 0 to 1.
        Returns:
